verses.text: 撒母耳膏立掃羅為王撒母耳拿了一瓶膏油，倒在掃羅的頭上，又與他親吻，說：「耶和華不是已經膏立你作他產業的領袖嗎？

words.note: Lit. 'anointing oil'.
Often refers to 'heritage' or 'inheritance' in biblical context.

verses.text: 今天你離開我以後，在便雅憫境內的泄撒，靠近拉結墳墓的旁邊，必遇見兩個人。他們會對你說：『你去尋找的那幾頭母驢已經找到了。現在你父親放下了母驢的事，反而為你擔憂，說：我為我的兒子要怎麼辦呢？』

words.note: Refers to the territory of the tribe of Benjamin.

verses.text: 你要從那裡再往前去，直到他泊的橡樹那裡，必遇見三個上伯特利去敬拜 神的人，一個帶著三隻山羊羔，一個帶著三個餅，一個帶著一皮袋酒。

words.note: Specifically refers to a young goat or lamb, common in biblical sacrifice context.
Common vessel in ancient times, especially for liquids like wine or water.

verses.text: 他們必向你問安，並且給你兩個餅，你要從他們手中接過來。
然後，你要到 神的山去，那裡有非利士人的駐軍。你進城的時候，會遇見一班先知從邱壇上下來。在他們前面有鼓瑟的、打鼓的、吹笛的、彈琴的。他們都受感說話。

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows first'.
A place of worship, often illicit or pagan, on a hill or mound.
Refers to playing an ancient stringed instrument, likely a harp or lyre.
Common activity, but here refers to ancient musical practice in a religious context.
Refers to playing a flute or pipe, common in ancient music.
Refers to playing an ancient stringed instrument, similar to a lyre or harp.
Implies receiving divine inspiration or spiritual influence.

verses.text: 耶和華的靈必大大感動你，你就要與他們一同受感說話，變成另一個人。

words.note: Often refers to the Holy Spirit in biblical contexts.
Reduplication for emphasis.
Refers to being moved by the Spirit, often leading to prophecy.

verses.text: 這些徵兆臨到你的時候，你就可以見機行事，因為 神與你同在。

words.note: An idiom meaning to adapt one's actions to changing circumstances.
Refers to the singular God, capitalized in English Bibles.
A common biblical phrase expressing God's presence.

verses.text: 你要在我以先下到吉甲去，我也要下到你那裡去獻燔祭和平安祭。你要等候七天，等我到了你那裡，指示你所當行的。」

words.note: Used before a verb to form a noun phrase 'that which is V-ed'.

verses.text: 掃羅受感說話掃羅轉身離開撒母耳的時候， 神就改變了他，賜給他一顆新心。那一天，這一切徵兆都實現了。

words.note: Refers to being moved by the Spirit, often leading to prophecy.
Refers to the singular God, capitalized in English Bibles.

words.definition: measure word for small, round objects

verses.text: 掃羅到了那山，有一班先知迎面而來。 神的靈大大感動他，他就在他們中間受感說話。

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.

words.definition: come face to face, come to meet

words.note: Refers to the singular God, capitalized in English Bibles.
Often refers to the Holy Spirit in biblical contexts.
Reduplication for emphasis.
Refers to being moved by the Spirit, often leading to prophecy.

verses.text: 所有以前認識掃羅的人，看見他和他們一起受感說話，就彼此說：「基士的兒子怎麼啦！掃羅也列在先知中間嗎？」

words.note: Commonly used in biblical context to mean 'to prophesy'.

words.definition: to be ranked among, listed in

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.

verses.text: 那裡有一個人回答：「這些人的父親是誰呢？」因此，後來有句俗語說：「掃羅也列在先知中間嗎？」

words.definition: to be ranked among, listed in

words.note: Lit. 'one who knows beforehand'.

verses.text: 掃羅受感說話完了以後，就到邱壇去了。

words.note: Commonly used in biblical context to mean 'to prophesy'.
Often refers to pagan worship sites or local shrines.

verses.text: 掃羅的叔叔問掃羅和他的僕人說：「你們到哪裡去了？」他回答：「找母驢去。我們找不到，就去見撒母耳。」

words.note: Verb-complement structure meaning 'unable to achieve the verb's goal'.

verses.text: 掃羅的叔叔說：「你把撒母耳對你們所說的話告訴我。」

words.note: Indicates the following noun is the object of the verb.
Precedes a verb to form a noun phrase meaning 'that which is V-ed'.

verses.text: 掃羅對他叔叔說：「他清楚地告訴我們，母驢已經找到了。」至於撒母耳所說有關王國的事，掃羅卻沒有告訴他的叔叔。

words.note: Forms a noun phrase from a verb or verb phrase.

verses.text: 掃羅被抽選為王撒母耳召集眾民到米斯巴耶和華那裡，

words.note: Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 對他們說：「耶和華以色列的 神這樣說：『我把你們以色列人從埃及帶上來，我救你們脫離埃及人的手，又救你們脫離所有欺壓你們的列國人的手。』

words.note: Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.
The preceding space character is often used in Chinese Bibles for reverence.
Introduces object before verb, emphasizing disposal/effect.

verses.text: 你們今天卻離棄了那位拯救你們脫離一切災難和困苦的 神，竟對他說：『求你立一個王統治我們。』現在你們要按著你們的支派和家族，站在耶和華面前。」

words.note: The preceding space character is often used in Chinese Bibles for reverence.
Transliteration of the Hebrew name for God.

verses.text: 撒母耳使以色列眾支派都近前來，抽籤抽中了便雅憫支派；
他又使便雅憫支派按著家族近前來，抽籤抽中了馬特利族；再抽籤抽中了基士的兒子掃羅。眾人尋找他，卻找不到。

words.note: Lit. 'draw a lot/sign'
Verb-complement structure indicating inability to find.

verses.text: 於是他們求問耶和華：「那人到這裡來了沒有？」耶和華說：「他躲在那些物件中。」

words.note: Used at end of sentence to form a yes/no question.
Often used as a locative suffix (e.g., 物件中).

verses.text: 他們就跑過去，把他從那裡領出來；他站在眾人中間，比眾人都高出一個頭。

words.note: Used in '把' construction to reorder sentence elements.

verses.text: 撒母耳對眾民說：「你們看見耶和華所揀選的人沒有？在眾人中沒有一個可與他相比。」眾人就大聲歡呼：「願王萬歲！」

words.note: Indicates the following verb is acted upon or describes a noun.
Used at end of sentence to form a yes/no question.
Often used as a locative suffix (e.g., 眾人中).
Traditional acclamation for a ruler, meaning 'ten thousand years of life'.

verses.text: 撒母耳把國法對眾人述說了，又記在書上，存放在耶和華面前，然後遣散眾人，各回自己的家去了。

words.note: Used in '把' construction to reorder sentence elements.
Locative phrase combining noun + direction/position.

verses.text: 掃羅也回基比亞自己的家裡去了，有一些勇士與他一起回去；他們的心都被 神感動。

words.note: Indicates completion or change of state.
Refers to the divine being.

verses.text: 但是有些流氓說：「這人怎能拯救我們呢？」就藐視他，也沒有送他禮物。掃羅卻沒有說甚麼。

words.note: Can refer to 'worthless fellows' in biblical contexts.
